qas.question: Many Slavic populations that were part of the Warsaw Pact are originally from where?

answers.text: the Russian SFSR, Ukrainian SSR and Byelorussian SSR

qas.question: What is the largest Slavic minority?
Where is the largest Slavic minority located?
What other Slavic minorities are in Kazakhstan?
What country has the largest Ukrainian population?

plausible_answers.text: the Russian SFSR, Ukrainian SSR and Byelorussian SSR

qas.question: What was the Warsaw Pact originally part of?
What is the largest population in Kazakhstan?
What is an example of a satellite state?
What is the smallest minority in Kazakhstan?

context: Former Soviet states, as well as countries that used to be satellite states or <b7_0>territories of the Warsaw Pact<b7_0/>, have numerous minority Slavic populations, many of whom are originally from <a0_0><b5_0>the Russian SFSR, Ukrainian SSR and Byelorussian SSR<b5_0/><a0_0/>. As of now, <a2_0><b4_0>Kazakhstan<b4_0/><a2_0/> has the largest <b8_0>Slavic<b8_0/> minority population with most being <a1_0><b6_0>Russians<b6_0/><a1_0/> (<a3_0>Ukrainians, Belarusians and Poles<a3_0/> are present as well but in much smaller numbers).
